text: 2023-07-19 hplot 0.0.6 Change xlabel ylabel xlab ylab! 2023-01-18 hplot 0.0.4 Added median output stats addnorm, modified categoryplot plotxyy 2022-09-05 hplot 0.0.3 Added RGB, wrapper using rgb numbered named colours maxColorValue=255. 2022-09-04 hplot 0.0.2 Added makepolygon, simplifies generation input data polygon.

title: addlnorm estimates a log-normal distribution from output of hist. — addlnorm

title: addlnorm estimates a log-normal distribution from output of hist. — addlnorm
code: egdata <- rlnorm(200,meanlog=0.075,sdlog=0.5) outh <- hist(egdata,main="",col=2,breaks=seq(0,8,0.2)) ans <- addlnorm(outh,egdata) lines(ans[,"x"],ans[,"y"],lwd=2,col=4)

title: addnorm adds a normal distribution to a histogram of a data set. — addnorm
addnorm adds a normal distribution to a histogram of a data set. — addnorm
text: inhist output call 'hist' (see examples) xdata data plotted histogram. inc defaults value 0.01; fine grain increment used define normal curve. histogram coarse grained relative .

title: addnorm adds a normal distribution to a histogram of a data set. — addnorm
text: list vector 'x' values vector 'y' values (   used plot fitted normal probability density function), vector    four called 'stats' containing mean, standard deviation, number    observations median input data

title: addnorm adds a normal distribution to a histogram of a data set. — addnorm
code: x <- rnorm(1000,mean=5,sd=1) dev.new(height=6,width=4,noRStudioGD = TRUE) par(mfrow= c(1,1),mai=c(0.5,0.5,0.3,0.05)) par(cex=0.85, mgp=c(1.5,0.35,0), font.axis=7) outH <- hist(x,breaks=25,col=3,main="") nline <- addnorm(outH,x) lines(nline$x,nline$y,lwd=3,col=2) print(nline$stats) #>         mean        stdev            N       median  #>    4.9777462    0.9917299 1000.0000000    4.9875784

TRUE prints column totals  sequentially addlines-2 lines addlines-1 lines circles addlines addtotal TRUE number lines added  top plot contain column totals. argument determines  number extra lines. default=3, smaller  number appropriate. addtotal = FALSE, addlines  ignored textcex totals top plot can large default=1 change value required.

text: x data.frame data least 'Year' pickvar present xlimit xaxis bounds histograms, defaults c(NA,NA,NA), values used seq(xlimit[1],xlimit[2],xlimit[3]). default used 0 0.98 quantiles variable used bounds 25 bins pickvar variable plot year default = 'cpue' years variable name identifies yaer column, default='year' varlabel label use x-axis, default = 'CPUE' vline optional vertical line aid interpretation. numeric added plot plots many plots generate, default = c(5,5) normadd normal distribution added plot.  default=TRUE left side plot year number records  placed left=TRUE default. left=FALSE place text right

what: inthist a replacement for the hist and boxplot functions — inthist
title: inthist a replacement for the hist and boxplot functions — inthist
text: inthist common want generate list counts     integers input vector plot columns     counts. Alternatively, common two-column matrix      values counts totals one wants plot columns     counts totals values. inhist allows one enter either      vector integers counted plotted matrix values      column 1 counts totals column 2. option rounding      non-integers available.

title: inthist a replacement for the hist and boxplot functions — inthist
code: inthist(   x,   col = 1,   border = NULL,   width = 0.9,   xlab = "",   ylab = "",   main = "",   lwd = 1,   xmin = NA,   xmax = NA,   ymax = NA,   plotout = TRUE,   prop = FALSE,   inc = 1,   xaxis = TRUE,   roundoff = TRUE,   ... )

title: inthist a replacement for the hist and boxplot functions — inthist
text: x vector integers counted plotted matrix values column 1 counts totals column 2 col colour fill; defaults black = 1, set 0 empty bar, give value border border colour outline bar defaults col width denotes width bar; defaults 0.9, >0 <= 1 xlab label x axis; defaults "" ylab label y axis; defaults "" main title individual plot; defaults "" lwd line width border; defaults 1 xmin sets lower bound x-axis; used match plots, defaults  NA whereupon minimum values used xmax sets upper bound x axis; used multiple plots,  defaults NA whereupon maximum values used ymax enables external control maximum y value; mainly use plotting multiple plots together. plotout plot histogram ? Defaults TRUE prop plot proportions rather counts, default=FALSE inc sets xaxis increment; used customize axis; defaults 1. xaxis set FALSE define xaxis outside inthist; defaults TRUE roundoff values integers rounded become integers? default=TRUE. Obviously useful inputting matrix. ... available pass extra plot arguments,  panel.first=grid(), whatever internal plot call

title: inthist a replacement for the hist and boxplot functions — inthist
text: matrix values counts proportions counts      values returned invisibly

title: inthist a replacement for the hist and boxplot functions — inthist
code: x <- trunc(runif(1000)*10) + 1   inthist(x,col="grey",border=3,width=0.75,xlabel="Random Uniform",           ylabel="Frequency") #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter    x <- as.matrix(cbind(c(1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8),trunc(runif(8,1,20))))   inthist(x,col="grey",border=3,width=0.75,xlabel="integers",           ylabel="Frequency") #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "xlabel" is not a graphical parameter #> Warning: "ylabel" is not a graphical parameter

what: makepolygon simplifies the creation of a polygon from xy data — makepolygon
title: makepolygon simplifies the creation of a polygon from xy data — makepolygon
text: makepolygon simplifies generation outline data     plotting polygon one pair lines graph one wants     use bounds polygon. example, given time-series      biomass trajectories across years, one may wish impose, say, 90th     quantiles illustrate trends variation changes time.     One can use single coloured lines o depict bounds , alternatively,     one can use polygon filled rgb transparent colour      clearly show outcome. especially useful trying      compare different sets time-series. overlap differences     become clear visually.

title: makepolygon simplifies the creation of a polygon from xy data — makepolygon
makepolygon simplifies the creation of a polygon from xy data — makepolygon
text: y1 y-axis values one time-series y2 y-axis values series x1 x-axis values (often years) relating y1 values x2 x-axis values (often years) relating y2 values. expected often x2 identical x1 default value x2 = NULL, case set - x1 inside function

title: makepolygon simplifies the creation of a polygon from xy data — makepolygon
text: two column matrix can act input polygon function

title: makepolygon simplifies the creation of a polygon from xy data — makepolygon
code: yrs <- 2000:2020 nyrs <- length(yrs) reps <- 100 av <- 5:(nyrs+4) dat <- matrix(0,nrow=reps,ncol=nyrs,dimnames=list(1:reps,yrs)) for (i in 1:nyrs) dat[,i] <- rnorm(reps,mean=av[i],sd=2) qs <- apply(dat,2,quantile) poldat <- makepolygon(y1=qs[2,],y2=qs[4,],x1=yrs) plot(yrs,dat[1,],type="p",pch=16,cex=0.2,col=1,ylim=c(0,30), panel.first=grid(),xlab="years",ylab="data") for (i in 1:reps) points(yrs,dat[i,],pch=16,col=1,cex=0.2) polygon(poldat,border=NULL,col=rgb(1,0,0,0.1))

what: plotprep sets up a window and the par values for a single plot — plotprep
title: plotprep sets up a window and the par values for a single plot — plotprep
text: plotprep sets window par values single      plot. checks see graphics device open opens new      one . simply utility function save typing      standard syntax. defaults can changed. Typing name     without () provide template modification. 'windows'      called repeatedly generate new active graphics device      time leaving older ones inactive present. quick      exploratory plots behaviour wanted, hence check      active device exists already .

title: plotprep sets up a window and the par values for a single plot — plotprep
code: plotprep(   width = 6,   height = 3.6,   usefont = 7,   cex = 0.85,   newdev = FALSE,   filename = "",   resol = 300,   verbose = TRUE )

title: plotprep sets up a window and the par values for a single plot — plotprep
text: width defaults 6 inches = 15.24cm - width plot height defaults 3 inches = 7.62cm - height plot usefont default 7 (bold Times) 1 sans serif, 2 sans serif bold cex default 0.85, font size font used text plots newdev reuse previously defined graphics device make new one; defaults FALSE filename defaults "" = save filename. filename input last three characters checked png .png added. resol resolution png file, defined, default=300 verbose set FALSE turn reminder include  graphics.() command plot. Default=TRUE

title: plotprep sets up a window and the par values for a single plot — plotprep

code: setplot() #> #if (names(dev.cur()) %in% c("null device","RStudioGD"))  #> #    dev.new(width=width,height=height,noRStudioGD = TRUE)  #> #graphfile <- "name.tiff" OR "name.pdf" OR name.png   #> #if (file.exists(graphfile)) file.remove(graphfile)   #> #tiff(file=graphfile,width=150,height=150,units="mm",res=300, #>       compression=c("lzw")) OR   #> #pdf(file=graphfile,onefile=T,width=8,height=6,family="Times") OR  #> #png(filename=graphfile,width=150,height=100,units="mm",res=300, #>       family="Times")  #>  #> par(mfrow=c(1,1),mai=c(0.45,0.45,0.05,0.05),oma=c(0.0,0,0.0,0.0))  #> par(cex=0.85, mgp=c(1.35,0.35,0), font.axis=7,font=7,font.lab=7)  #> ymax <- max(y,na.rm=T) * 1.05  #> plot(x,y,type="l",xlab="",ylab="",col=1,ylim=c(0,ymax),yaxs="i", #>       lwd=2)  #> title(ylab=list("ylabel", cex=1.0, font=7),   #>       xlab=list("xlabel", cex=1.0, font=7))  #>  #> legend(0,0.45,c("True Mean","Precise","Imprecise"),col=c(4,1,2), #>       lwd=3,bty="n",cex=1.0)  #> mtext("label",side=2,outer=T,line=0.0,font=7,cex=1.0)  #>  #> #dev.off()  #> #graphics.off()

code: plotprep(width=7, height=9)   parset(plots=c(3,1))   x <- rlnorm(5000, meanlog=2, sdlog=1)   hist(x,breaks=30,main="",xlab="log-normal values")   uphist(x,breaks=30,main="",xlab="log-normal values",maxval=100)   uphist(x,breaks=30,main="",xlab="log-normal values",maxval=1000)

title: xyplotyear generates n year xy plots from a data.frame — xyplotyear
code: xyplotyear(   x,   yvar = "",   xvar = "",   year = "year",   plotnum = c(1, 1),   xlim = c(0, 12),   addline = TRUE,   origin = FALSE,   xlab = "",   ylab = "",   maxy = NA )

title: xyplotyear generates n year xy plots from a data.frame — xyplotyear
text: x data.frame containing data yvar character name y-axis column data.frame x xvar character name x-axis column data.frame x year name year variable, default="year" plotnum vector rows cols plots, default=c(1,1). assumes columns filled first using mfcol xlim range xvar plotted, default=c(0,12); c(NA,NA) xlim set range input xvar addline linear regression fitted added plot default=TRUE origin regression pass origin, default=FALSE xlab  generic label x-axis, default='', left empty  xvar name used ylab generic label y-axis, default='', left empty  yvar name used maxy available wish vary maximum y-axis value.  default=NA, means use getmax x 1.15 find maximum

what: yearBubble Generates a bubbleplot of x against Year. — yearBubble
title: yearBubble Generates a bubbleplot of x against Year. — yearBubble
text: yearBubble Generates bubbleplot x Year.

title: yearBubble Generates a bubbleplot of x against Year. — yearBubble
code: yearBubble(   x,   xlabel = "",   ylabel = "",   diam = 0.1,   vline = NA,   txt = c(4, 6, 9, 11),   Fyear = FALSE,   xaxis = TRUE,   yaxis = TRUE,   hline = FALSE,   nozero = FALSE )

title: yearBubble Generates a bubbleplot of x against Year. — yearBubble
text: x matrix variable * Year; although needn't year xlabel defaults nothing allows custom x-axis label ylabel defaults nothing allows custom y-axis label diam defaults 0.1, scaling factor adjust bubble size vline defaults NA allows vertical ablines higlight regions txt defaults lines vessel numbers, catches, catches, maximumY Fyear defaults FALSE, TRUE generates fishing year x-axis xaxis defaults TRUE, allows custom x-axis desired using something like axis(1,=years,labels=years). yaxis defaults TRUE, allows custom y-axis desired using something like axis(side=2,=years,labels=years). hline defaults FALSE nozero defaults FALSE, TRUE replaces zeros NA appear plot

title: yearBubble Generates a bubbleplot of x against Year. — yearBubble
text: invisible, vectors catch vessels year, radii matrix

title: yearBubble Generates a bubbleplot of x against Year. — yearBubble
code: if (FALSE) {  data(sps)  cbv <- tapply(sps$catch_kg,list(sps$Vessel,sps$Year),sum,na.rm=TRUE)/1000  dim(cbv)  early <- rowSums(cbv[,1:6],na.rm=TRUE)  late <- rowSums(cbv[,7:14],na.rm=TRUE)  cbv1 <- cbv[order(late,-early),]  plotprep(width=7,height=6)  yearBubble(cbv1,ylabel="Catch by Trawl",vline=2006.5,diam=0.2) }
